name: Ultimate Chicken Horse
description: Ultimate Chicken Horse is a party platformer game where you build the level as you play, placing traps and hazards to screw your friends over, but trying not to screw yourself.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2 or Later Processor: 1.5GHZ + Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB VRAM  Intel HD 4000 / GeForce 200  Series / Radeon HD 4000 Series DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2 GB available space Additional Notes: Broadband internet is required for online play.
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or later Processor: Dual Core 2.3 GHZ Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: 1024 MB VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space Additional Notes: Broadband internet is required for online play.

A great local/online multiplayer, perfect for playing with friends or your kids.   -Lots of obstacles and tramps to choose -Replayability -Funny characters to use (the raccoon is the best imo) -Awesome scenarios  Highly recommended :B
4 player transformice where everyone is the shaman.

Fun little game with endless possibilities.  One great thing I would really like to point out is that even though online part of the game is still in beta, what's great about it is that movement and collision is all happening client side, which means that you won't ever die or miss a platform because of lag. Although lag may sometimes looks like your opponents were hit and didn't die, that's just purely graphic problem.

BEST PARTY GAME EVER.  We played this game for hours with two of our best gaming friends and their two children. Four people who had no idea how to play this game picked it up in minutes, and then we all sat together on the couch roaring with laughter as we got decapitated by errant propellers and sucked into black holes. Even the one person who is basically incompetent at platformers (me!) had a great time.  The game is this. Each round, you and your opponents each add one element to a platforming obstacle course. Then, you all have to run the course. If nobody makes it through, nobody gets any points, so the goal is to make the course hard but still doable. Elements include stuff to jump on like planks and moving platforms, as well as hazards like circular saws and crossbows. You get points for completing the course, and you also get points if one of your hazards kills an opponent. There's a lighthearted and cartoonish aesthetic, which turns hilarious as dead characters get cartoonishly X-ed out eyes and goofily ragdoll through the course.  You can't get any better entertainment than this for fifteen bucks, guys. Go buy it!

Always love this genre of game, Great game to play with friends, each round you all take turns placing one new object into the puzzle, the goal is to try to play to your strengths and the people you're playing with's weaknesses, make a level which you can complete reliably but still that others fail (since if nobody fails to reach the end, no points are earned). the result usually ends up being something incredibly hard to beat that'll test your platforming skills to the limit, what starts off relatively easy can get incredibly complex with tons of elements to watch out for as you make a mad dash to the goalpost.

Actually a really fun little party platformer game, plug in multiple controllers with your friends and thats where the game really takes off.   Have had countless people take a first look at this game and get second thoughts on letting me convince them to have a go. But by the end of our sessions on this game, it can get as competitive between as playing AAA rated games can sometimes get at a fraction of the price!.  Actually looking forward to what the developers future plans are for this game as it has alot of promise!

If you can overcome the enormous hassle of assembling a bunch of controllers for a pc local multiplayer game, then you've stumbled onto an idea so simple and genius that it's a crime it didn't exist sooner. This feels like something that should have been included in Mario Maker, a level editor with creations challenged on the spot by everyone in the room at once then mishapen and malformed into a series of death machines and seemingly impossible jumps. The makeshift look to the whole experience and the cuddly animals building and falling prey to their own WMDs adds an amazing comical effect to each session; I couldn't remember a game I'd laughed so consistently with, and the goofs were built by my friends and I! This game is worth your time, and should be on your radar. If you love building friendships then tearing them apart with buzzsaws, this game's for you.

One of the most fun local multiplayer experiences in quite some time. Ultimate Chicken Horse feels different with each round played. I would recommend using a controller with this game.

NOTE TO ALL KEYBOARD PLAYERS! THE GAME IS STILL GREAT IF YOU DON'T HAVE A CONTROLLER! ALSO ONLINE WORKS A LOT BETTER NOW!  Now that I've gotten that out of the way...  This game is amazing! The gameplay is really fun, and you can play with friends OR strangers, locally and online! The best part about online is that you experience no server lag whatsoever, because it's all client-sided (i think that's the term)! You may see other people a little jittery, but like this, you can play with anybody around the world, and still have a blast, because all your movements are as smooth as if you were playing with someone right next to you! There still are some bugs, but the developpers are working to fix them.  Okay, I just want to point out... THE OST IS AMAZING! I'm so sad that I didn't buy it, because it's not on youtube, and I didn't think it would be this amazing! So if you can, buy it along with that soundtrack. So far, my favorite are waterfall and the party level. The graphics are fun and friendly, and all the animals look adorable! Each map in the game has some different thing about it, and each has their own song. You can find cosmetics for your animals, new animals in general, and new maps for when you host a server as you play!  In conclusion, I have not even played the game that much yet, but I'm already having a blast. When seananners first played this game, it looked so fun, and I waited for it to be on sale. Glad I bought this. Worth every cent. Wish I got that OST though, so amazing.
Horse can have Top hat and Bowtie  10/10
good game. it has its gltiches here and there, but still all in all a good game to play.

Ultimate Chicken Horse (UCH) is one of the best (local) multiplayer games out there when played with friends. It is a 2D-platformer with simple graphics, where each player choses a farm animal of his or her choice to compete against each other. Up to four players can play together in a total of 10 different levels, both local and online. Most of the levels (and some other stuff) is locked in the beginning and is randomly unlocked by playing certain levels at the right time (you'll now how and when to do this).   Basically, UCH is a Super Mario like Jump n'Run, where you have to reach the end of a level. However, there is a pretty cool twist to this old-school mechanic: After each 'race' in the current level, players have to chance to place an object to 'make the level more difficult'. In other words, they will try to f**k you up. Of course, they still want to finish the level as well. Thus, the placement of objects is a dilicate matter. There is a rather sophisticated point system involved to determine the winner of a level. For example, you can get 'post mortem' extra points...  The game offers some other game modes as well, but I think that the real fun begins if your play with three friends locally in the described 'party mode'. While the number of levels is low, the replay value is immensely high due to a random selection of items which can be placed each turn. In a recent patch, the developers also added the possibility to share levels between users, i.e., you are able to prepare a level with a choice of items and then send it your friends to see them fail. It really is a bit like Mario Maker for PC, but with chickens and horses.  One drawback is the rather small selection of items right now. There is definitly room for improvement, but certain mechanics and hillarious traps make up for it. Especially the fact that you can combine different items via 'honey' to make terrifying death traps. This also works for the various moving objects.  Overall, I really can recommend this game. It is one of the funniest multiplayer games I have played and has a good controller support. It works nice in local multiplayer and different options allow to customize the game modes further. However, I have not tried the included online mode yet, but this possibility exists as well.   Buy this game, you won't regret it! :)  4.5/5
A lot of fun. Definitely one of the best local co-op games, but also offers online play, whihc is currently in beta. This game is still in the early stages, but it is blast to play with friends.

Twas a cold stormy night and I had just purchased this game due to my friends constant comments. I played for the first time and my friend said that my placement of the blackhole was in a terrible position. The storm eventually started to get worse and my friend and I were tied for the final match, and we gave eachother alot of ♥♥♥♥ talk saying who would win. My friend then slipped up at the very end of the level and fell into the blackhole i had placed prior, and at that exact moment he disconnected. After about a minute later he texted me saying his power went out.  10/10 Would place 4th wall breaking blackhole again

Ulitmate Chicken Horse is an incredibly simple and charming platformer! However, although it one of the best party games I've picked up, the lack of ANY single player content was a bit discouraging at first. BUT KEEP READING.   Basically, an adorable cast of critters are pitted against the obstacles you and your friends (2-4 players) choose to place in a vareity of levels. This means the players themselves make their own diffculties ranging from walks in the park to the absolute embodiment of Satan himself. Yep, that's it.  At first the online portion of the game was um.. Shotty at best? But lord has that changed! Online connectivity has increased dramatically thanks to the latest updates! There's also couch to online coop. You're welcome~  The unlock system can be a rather confusing... I would simply recommend hosting online matches to increase your unlock rates (host seems to always unlock maps quickly).   So if you're in need of a party platformer or just want to create impossible, cancerous levels that nobody can beat, then do yourself a favor and pick Ulitmate Chicken Horse up today!!!
Very fun multiplayer game! I reccomend it!

I´ll start by saying that this game is AMAZING and really well made. The reason why I gave it a negative review is because the BUGS and bad community are overwelming making this such a frustrating experience that becomes almost impossible to play.  The bugs I ran into are super lame such as phantom games where you try to join but the game does not exist, or full games showing in the game list over and over again, inconsistency of traps where some times they act some way and others ways act differently like the plants that most of the times punch with a short delay and others immediatly, games that drop for no reason in the middle of the play, or even more serious ones where the game start but no one can take any action or some members can't select an item to play. I know most of this stuff seems rather simple but i guarantee you that it adds up with time and becomes unberable even because there are such a few games being played at any given time that its really frustrating to finally find one just to be dropped in the middle of it.   Another problem I found is the high latency. Yes I live in South America so I would not fit in any of the regions mentioned but I play many other games online in US servers with no problem at all and here I always recive a Bad Connection message.   Lastly the community...what to say, it all adds up in the end...There are a lot of kinds or trolls that either want to make levels super simple and explode EVERY single intelligent obstacle that would make the level interestingue or you find the total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that simply put a plank in front of a passage making it impassable and impossible. Sum all the bugs, with the few games and the poor community together and you get a TERRIBLE gaming experience out of an AMAZING game.   Buy this if you pretend to play local with some friends but dont do it for the online experience.
You have no reason not to.

I don't have connection issues as much as everyone says, but there are many times when the cursor doesn't appear (online mode) or the goal doesn't finish the round (offline mode). If those problems were fixed, I would consider this the perfect party game.  7/10 Would Strongly Recommend :D

More Reviews @  TheVideogameBacklog.com   This has to be one of the weirdest titles I’ve read in a long time. Along with that: it is also one of the more imaginative games I’ve played in a long time. Mixing up platforming with player-created-on-the-spot levels is genius.  While this game can be played with two people, or yourself and three other controllers, The Ultimate Chicken Horse is a dish best served with three other people (always better with friends)! As the level changes after every round as dictated by each player, the levels only get crazier and crazier. Unless someone uses the bomb and cleans it up a little. However, sometimes some spring cleaning is in order unless you don’t really want to progress.  Allowing on-line play was one of the smartest moves for Clever Endeavour Games. It’s not something that I can remember many small party games like this having missed lately, but it is something I could see someone taking a stance on. “Get your friends over like we did back in the day.” That’s weird to some people, but that was the norm back when I was a kid. It’s buggy currently, but they are diligently working on it. All this to say: it will still be more fun with your buds right there to punch.  I can understand the way multplayer is done currently, but it’s not my favorite. Given the flavor of the game, a more open multiplayer would have been more appreciated. However, since trying to make my own game and getting caught up with tiny details not working, if it was this “port-forwarding-friend-menu”method or nothing, then this trumps any complaint. I simply got used to this method of connecting with Magicite, but didn’t really appreciate it because of the lack of friends playing the same game. I like these type of games while not many of my buds would be willing to drop as little change down as Ultimate Chicken Horse costs. A more fluid, server-based multiplayer would have opened the floodgates to a more populated online experience in an ideal world. It could very well have been a lot of time spent coding and then been underused and that time could have been better spent. There are to many variables and let’s just say that I’m happy to at least have the option.  Score: Tasty!  Ultimate Chicken Horse is pretty darn unique. It still surprises me that some devs can come up with something like this out of nowhere when it feels like it should have been a part of our gaming library for a long time now. There are a lot of tools to hinder you and your friends with and enough levels to add some variety to the gameplay. Ultimate Chicken Horse is definitely worth picking up if you’ve got some buds that enjoy good platforming fun-time.

There is basically one solid rule in game design; give agency to your player. This game fails in this immediately. The controls are thoroughly inconsistent. Don't get me wrong. This is a great concept (make a level challenging enough to kill your friends but not so impossible that you yourself cannot complete it) but it is executed poorly. If I am playing the game I should be in control of what I do. My mistakes should be my own, not caused by the interface. A friend compared it to Super Meat Boy. I played SMB. It was good. There were no random elements to the movement. This was terrible.

This game is arguably the best party game. The online can be a bit buggy (though it's been getting better with every update), but even if it were perfect a lot of the fun comes from the banter with your friends when someone's clogged up the entry with 'Canadians' (what we ended up calling the hockey puck launchers).  The gameplay itself is simple - a 2D platformer where you have to get to the flag. The first few maps are also incredibly simple. Each round after everyone dies or reaches the flag, you get given a selection of traps or platforms to pick from and each add one to the map. As it goes on, it gets more chaotic.  It has lots of replayability because of the randomness in terms of what setpieces you're given, but also the more complex maps can have more fun interactions between traps and movables that are a part of the map.  Waterfall and Windmill are quite frustrating because completing them after the first round of placements is often a rarity, which makes the game have quite a slow start, but that's the only criticism I have about the game.  I was going to nominate this for 'Best Use of a Farm Animal', but decided that actually it should be nominated for 'Most Prominent Featuring of Farm Animals' because in terms of gameplay they could be literally anything that's small and cute. But that's just me being picky in the wording of awards.   Go buy this game.

Amazing party game!  It's quite nice that it supports hot seating as well as each player having their own controller - each allows a different style of play.  Definitely a laugh when playing as a group. The levels design is really good - they're simple, but allow for creative trap and platform placement.  Highly recommend!

This game is one of the most fun, entertaining games I've played. This game is entertaining to play as it is to watch. It is still in its infancy and has tons of potential as new features get added. I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves to have fun and love building.

Probably my favourite game of 2016, just the base mechanic is brilliant. You and your opponents collectively build a challenging but completable level, and then you compete against one another to reach the finish the fastest.  While I suggest the best way to play is local multiplayer, the online multiplayer works well with a few hiccups here and there.  I’ve been playing since Early Access in May 2016 and I have been surprised at the amount of effort the developers have put into consistently updating and improving the game. It’s one of those games where I find myself coming back to play a round or a few whenever I have some free time.  If you enjoy platformers or building contraptions I highly suggest Ultimate Chicken Horse.

It's like Super Mario Maker With Friends. This game is a HUGE amount of fun, either with friends, or random online strangers. Frequent updates, such as the level editor, ensure that this game will always stay fresh. Also, this game is a sure-win for the 2016 Steam Award for 'Best Use of a Farm Animal'.

This is the only platformer where you intentionally make it way too hard for yourself becuase you want to screw over your friend. Plus, the developer is still actively developing the game. But really, you can dress up the animals, so yeah.

If you play platformers at a decent level, you can play this game knowing you'd win most of the matches. So many players I've played against play like they never touched a single platformer before. There are quite a fair amount of bugs going on as of this review. Most often the game will play at a smooth level. Not something people with small patience should play though.

Bought this game last night to play with my brothers and sister in law. This game is incredibly fun and easy to use. It's a blast to play a map for a long time and eventually find new ways around obstacles someone placed to troll.   I've played games such as Gang Beasts, Duck Game, Speedrunners, and HIPS with them but this is by far one of the best. It's mechanics and silliness will keep us entertained for a long time to come. The level progression is very simple and easy to get used to, you play a number of games and inside one of them a box will pop up. If you open the box by hitting it, you unlock skins, characters, or levels. Great game. I expect to play this much more

Ultimate chicken horse is...quite a game. A game where you start with only the basics of a party game, and then unlock plenty of stuff as you in this party, platformer duo where the goal is to get from point A to point B while making a crazy level.  Now that the concept it out of the way, what's the pros and cons  Pros: -Plenty of level varity -unlock galore -Great with 2 or 3 other freinds -Now stable online. -You can play as a Robotic bunny getting sucker punched by a flower.  Cons: -15 dollars may be a bit expensive, but consant updates makes the game fun. -Occasional problems with glitches. -Couch mode is kinda boring online.   But besides for that, if you need a platformer party game, this is the one for you!
Funny, easy entertaining!

tldr: a very creative and smart idea :o  a super fun couch-party game that basically allows you to make the level as you and your friends try to complete it, which leads to a hilarious risk/reward system where you try to reach that point where you can clear the level but nobody else can. making it hard for other people makes it harder for you, too--so there's no real straight-up d  ick moves that don't directly put you at risk as well, everyone is pretty much on even ground, while randomized blocks keeps the gameplay fresh every time. there's a lot of ways people can work together to make crazy things in a level. not to mention the tight meatboy-like platforming controls that ensure the game's always just overall fun to play!!!!!!!! GOOD JOB  AND online

Overall, Ultimate Chicken Horse is a pretty fun game for a while, with easy to pick up control, a good dose of randomness and should be an all round satisfier, even if from time to time it does get a bit boring.  Pros: - Nice cartoonish graphics, they won't win any awards but they are decent and flow smoothly - Support for controllers as it seems to be a primarily console game, even if on the PC version this means that all controls are listed as you would use them on a controller, which isn't helpful to PC users - Multiplayer works very well and smoothly - Online mode works generally well although with many bugs, but to be fair, I was given more than sufficient warning - Thoughtfully made achievements - Different maps don't do that much, but they are nice to have - Funny, slapstick style gameplay makes it appropriate and appealing for all ages  Cons: - Obviously the many bugs in multiplayer mode, including random lagging outs can get annoying - Gets boring after a while and shouldn't be overplayed - Sometimes it gets to that point in the level where there are so many objects it is virtually impossible to get anywhere and apart from the bomb you can't just delete that one annoying obstacle getting in the way  7/10 or B
A Chicken, Horse, Raccon, and Sheep walk into a blade... No Winners! No Points!.... 10/10

Up to four players compete in a simple challenge: reach the flag. To get there, you must build the course yourselves. Add platforms, stairs, springs, and all manner of traps to create a course that only you can defeat. You must screw over the other players, but be careful not to screw yourself!  Ultimate Cooperation Ultimate Competition Ultimate Chicken Horse

I love this game, its funny, silly, and challenging at the same time. you know a game is good when I only owned the game for 3 days and already have 10 hours on it

Fantastic Game, Really, I'm glad that steam suggested it to me! I hope the developers are still reading and working on it, it has soo much pontential to improve what is already great! After becoming the ultimate horse my life has never been the same.

I can't really say whether you should buy this game or not its more about the type of gamer you are but if I had to tell you... OMG THIS IS THE BEST GAME EVER OMG THE CREATORS CAN I HAVE YOUR SUTOGRAPH AUUUUUUUU *Faints* Thats all I have to say about how fun and delightful this game is! Oh and the characters are adorable. Best money I ever spent. Though they need to fix the fact that if you load a level in the level thingy and play it it is always laggy and it sucks. I don't know why. I haven't seen a level creator game that lags this much when playing someone elses level so they need to fix that otherwise it is a great game!

This is the perfect game of 'Watch me swooce right in'. Fun times to be had all around with multiple items and hazards to claim victory, or just massacre your friends with as they try to reach the goal.
Ultimate Chicken Horse is a fun platformer party game that my friends and I love to play. Definetly recommended.
The funnest co op game ever
Great game to play Local play with Friends! tons of laughs!
Good party game! Works well with multiple types of controllers and both local and online play.

I nominated this game for the 'best use of a farm animal' Steam award because both the gameplay and characters are hilarious. Ultimate Chicken Horse makes for a great party game as you work with friends to make a devlishly difficult but not impossible obstacle course. The traps and obstacles are awesome, and nothing beats the feeling of watching your friend get skewered by a crossbow bolt or sucked in to a vortex. I also appreciate that the game is easily played in hotseat mode.
i hate my friends now  10/10
Want to bring out the worst from your friends? Play this game. Guaranteed laughters then anger then hopelessness then laugh it off again.  One of the best couch co-op game I've played.
More like ultimate horse hockey
Love this game!!!!!!

I can't honestly say a bad thing about this game. Beautiful game with an amazingly fun community. Great for those slow, boring days when others games just don't appeal to you. Nominated for 'Best Use of a Farm Animal' award. xD
Amazing party game! play it with friends or family for the best time! And then wonder why it is 3:30am.........

God tier game. Promotes great banter. Would recommend trying 2 tile wide jumps and 'trumby jumps' (3WP2-JDU5). Perfectly balanced with the ability to change settings to any desired gametype. Would love to see new characters/levels which I imagine is likely considering the developers seem very responsive. Would recommend to any friend, 9.5/10 party game.
I expected to hate this game. I love this game. Buy it, play it.
'Best use of a farm animal'

ULTIMATE CHICKEN HORSE  This is a real epic party game, best played with your mates on the couch. A fun platformer where you create your own level to make it harder or easier for yourself while trying to screw your friend. Every round is different and thats why this game is always fun to play and doesn't get boring. The game plays smooth and I like the art a lot. I've had a lot of fun with this game.
Love this game! Easy to play and a lot of fun
This game is amazing  10/10  would rage again.
This is the most fun you can have with friends and/or family. Buy it now (if you have friends and/or family).

This game is absolutely ridiculous. It's a ton of fun to play with some friends. It is basically a game of screwing everyone else over but trying to win yourself. 11/10 would make it impossible to win again
This game is so fun to play with friends. You can make others rage, build strange contraptions, and play as a raccoon. What more could you want.
Super fun game for parties and friends and family!

This is one of the best party games I've ever played. And I've been playing Smash Bros competitively for 5 years now so I know a party game when I see one. AND IT HAS COUCH MULTIPLAYER IN 2016 NOTHING HAS THAT ANYMORE
Things I've done in this game:  Created a Chinese sweatshop noice-equivilent  BRoke THe BAnk  Created a Crown of Thorns  Saw Face McMega♥♥♥♥  ANUBIS  GEODE
I love that you can easly create your own leaval and each time is different
This game is great, frustrating, simply-yet-creative, imaginative and really just a lot of fun.  Buy it and be the Ultimate!
Most fun i've had in a while, playing with friends. Online MP works great
Very nice game.
I simply love this game!
Awesome game to play with friends. Good for those who like to win, but have fun even when you lose.

I love this game, its chaos and fun rolled together. So why am I not recomending this? One the key features DOESN'T WORK. You are suppose to put objects down whether they be traps, platforms or something else, the goal remains the same. Get to the goal. Now most the online games I've played I have been UNABLE to grab an item. Some times I've been kicked for not being able to grab. I can't say the same for local because I don't have friends. If you can play local, buy it.  I will change my vote when they fix this bug.   EDIT: I don't know what it was, but everything seems okay now. Get this game for some 'How did I get hit by that?' moments.
masochism realized   10/10 would glue saws to moving parts
